item.title: The Structure for Season 2
item.description:
The upcoming season of UMKL will be using a Swiss Style system to determine the winner, but what exactly is that?

Season 2 is scheduled to start in October 2025.

A Swiss System Tournament, most commonly used in chess, draws opponents against each other based on their current standings and match records, resulting in closer matches and near accurate skill based matchmaking. This simply means that teams who win will play teams who win, and teams who lose will play teams who lose; there is no 'elimination' and everybody gets to keep on playing!

This system allows us to reduce the number of matchdays required for each team, which helps when most players are also full time students, and with the huge influx in teams this season it's just not feasible nor efficient to play almost 70 matches in the space of a few months.

With a Swiss System we reduce that number down to 24 matches, which will be closer fought and more entertaining for both players and the audience.

With Season 2 starting in October we hope that everyone enjoys the upcoming matches, and we look forward to seeing our teams back in action very soon!

This article is an explation of an announcement made on the UMKL Discord server, you can join the server here.

item.title: Cheep Cheep Updates
item.description:
Hi all! Here are a few updates.

It's been a few months since the announcement of @Cheep Cheep app, since then a lot of new commands and features have been added.

Work is being done constantly to improve the stability of our systems we use for UMKL, so we hope everyone is happy with the continued development!

The most important change from the previous message is that the /register has been removed, as it is no longer required to use /join when you're joining a team. A full changelog will be listed at the end of this page.

A few test matches have occurred recently and they've gone smoothly, so more test matches will follow! So be sure to check the matches page for upcoming matches!

Below are some newly added commands that can be used in the server!

Changelog for the 17/07/2025 update
  • /register removed, it is no longer required to use /join
  • New command - /leaderboards
  • Formatted YYYY-MM-DD to DD/MM/YYYY in embeds (only for outputted text, not for command inputs)
  • Added the match versus image on the sign-up embed
  • Changed the date in the sign-up embed to a timestamp
  • New command - /change-team-colour (board only)
  • Internal changes to SQL/DB threading
  • Internal changes to the API used on umkl.co.uk
  • Tweaked graphics to add shadowing beneath text to improve contrast and readability
  • New command - /generate-stream-overlay
  • Fixed /team-profile
  • New commands (used for streaming overlay):
    • /add-results-to-liveresults
    • /edit-results-in-liveresults
    • /reset-liveresults
  • New command - /submit-room-code
  • New command - /report-disconnection
  • Added some easter eggs

This article is a summary of an announcement made on the UMKL Discord server, you can join the server here.

item.title: Information for universities wanting to join
item.description:
Intro

Joining the University Mario Kart League is a commitment to the future of Mario Kart e-sports in the United Kingdom, and we would love to have your university represented in the league.

The UMKL presents an exciting opportunity for students across the country to make connections and have fun alongside their studies, while also providing a look into the growing competitive scene of Mario Kart.

Being a part of the University Mario Kart League is a responsibility. University teams are expected to maintain a level of activity throughout the season, as with many teams comes a greater weight on scheduling.

Teams are also expected to act respectfully and dignified to both their opponents and their peers, and we reserve the right to pull a team from the league if they are acting in problematic manner.

Season 2 is scheduled to start in October 2025.

Creating a New Team

If you are interested in creating a new team in the UMKL to represent your university, please check whether there are enough players at your university who are interested in participating.

A team must have a minimum of six players available to play in every match, so make sure there are more than enough players to fill this requirement. Members of your university do not need to play in matches to be part of your team.

University teams should not be tied to a specific society in a university. Although specific societies in the university may be Mario Kart or e-sports/gaming focused, anybody in the univeristy should be free to join the team regardless of their affiliation with these specific societies.

Important
All efforts must be made within your university's team to include everyone, such as discussing match line-ups in the UMKL server (not in a separate society's server that some members may not have access to, as an example) and keeping teamwide practise to within the UMKL server.
This is important to keep the UMKL free and open for everyone.

Promotion of the UMKL via society channels is allowed, but a distinction must be made about how you do not need to be part of that society to be part of the UMKL team. Please read the Brand Guidelines page for more details about how you can use UMKL intellectual property and content.

Please note that current students, alumni, university faculty and prospective students (holding an offer) are welcome to join your team, but students outside of your university may not be allowed.

Note
Please visit the Team Guidelines page for rules associated with a new team's credentials

Teams should thoroughly brief themselves on the match rules and relay this information to their players before forming a team. The majority of our matches are livestreamed and recorded for entertainment and promotion, and teams should also make their players aware of this. Players should be briefed on this fact and be told about the consequences of misconduct should it occur on our live matches.

Once teams have completed the above requirements, they should contact the board with their request to join and we will review it. This is best done on the UMKL Discord server. If accepted, your team will be inducted into the following season of the league. A season will typically begin in October, and end in April, with matches taking a break during the winter holidays.

If accepted, the board will ask your team to nominate two individuals to join the board. These members will then be able to use the /create-team command.

Conclusion

We hope that everything here is clear, and we look forward to seeing your team joining the UMKL and competing in the next season. For any questions, queries or inquiries contact any of the board members and we would be more than happy to help!

You can join our Discord server here and find our YouTube channel here.

item.title: Join the UMKL Discord server!
item.description:
The University Mario Kart League Discord server is the beating heart of our operations.

From match organisation, to game results and general UMKL activity, the Discord server is the fastest way to keep up to date with the UMKL.

The server is also a thriving hub for all UMKL news, and is a great way to connect with other players and make friends across the UK.


With the Cheep Cheep app, users can fetch player and match data in the server.

Featured in our Discord server is our bespoke app - Cheep Cheep, ready to provide data about players in the UMKL, stats about teams. It can also manage a team's current roster before each match, and generate sleek custom images after every match, showing a team and player's score, along with the standings for a current season.
The Cheep Cheep app was developed by Adeola Adeniji, zy and Tushar Sundarka, please visit the credits for all UMKL credits.

It's also loaded with a bunch of tools helping board members manage matches and teams. This all ensures smooth running of the league.

The server is also the quickest way to contact the UMKL board, who are happy to answer any of your questions and queries. This is helpful for upcoming teams and universities who might be interested in taking part in future seasons.
Please visit Information for universities wanting to join for more information on this topic.

Whether you're a player, a committee member or a fan, come join our Discord server and be a part of our lovely community!

You can join our Discord server here.

item.title: Welcome to the UMKL!
item.description:
Welcome to the University Mario Kart League!

If you've reached this page, you probably have an idea of what we do, but we'll explain more below!

We're an independent gaming league made up of university teams across the country, which compete in 6v6 Mario Kart 8 Deluxe matches.

This project started last year, where we had four university teams in play, but this has quickly expanded to universities across the country! Currently we're still growing, with 6v6 test matches and friendlies being played until our next season starts next academic year.


Season 2 is scheduled to start in October 2025.

We're one season down, with our reigning champions York topping the charts for Season 1.


Some team logos were incomplete during Season 1.

Currently, whilst we're working on our website and the next season's roster, we are currently having on-going test matches between our teams and practice rooms.

The UMKL discord is growing daily, with more and more interest being shown in our matches and livestreams, as we carve out our own little niche in gaming culture.

We are run by students, for students, and remain dedicated to forging connections between universities. Our 6v6 comp format gives uni groups ample opportunity to communicate with each other, improve their Mario Kart 8 Deluxe skills, and grow as a team together.

With 12 players and 12 races per match, get ready to practice your green shell snipes, bomb throws, and to communicate effectively as a team to speed towards victory!

You can join our Discord server here.
Our YouTube channel, where we livestream matches, can be visited here.

Please visit the credits to see everyone who worked on the University Mario Kart League.
